abstracts.cdata!:
This Investigation Report presents the
            Inspection Panel's findings from its investigation on
            the matters alleged in the Request for Inspection (see
            report no. 31576). The Panel found the following: In the
            project's focus on concessions, the Bank ignored or at
            least marginalized other aspects important to the Bank
            program in Cambodia and to the Government during the
            planning process. The project did not give adequate
            attention to vital interests of local communities and
            indigenous peoples in forest resources, and to the contested
            nature of forest domain. Rather the Bank gave primary
            emphasis in project design to the technical and financial
            aspects of concession reform at the expense of environmental
            and social aspects. The Panel also expressed concern, that
            certain parts of the guidelines about the concession review
            process developed under the project do not meet Bank
            safeguard policy requirements ad do not provide adequate
            framework for the Government to decide on any future
            forestry concessions. Unless this is remedied, the project
            will not achieve one of its main objectives to demonstrate
            and improve effectiveness of comprehensive forest management
            and operational guidelines in the forest concession area.
            The panel also addressed the choice of the Learning
            Innovation Loan (LIL) as a financing instrument;
            identification and protection of forests of high ecological
            value, of natural habitats, of the affected population and
            the project area, and of cultural property (spirit forests
            and archeological sites); the need for an environmental
            assessment, the project's environmental categorization;
            the need for a social assessment; impacts on local people of
            illegal logging of resin trees; consultations with affected
            people during project preparation; preparation of an
            indigenous peoples development plan; technical assistance
            that was provided; and the adequacy of Strategic Forest
            Management Plans (SFMP) and Environmental and Social Impact
            Assessments (ESIA).
